but of what was attempted, requested, refused, and left undocumented.

Each entry is part of a wider cycle:
â†’ Legal request â†’ Institutional response or silence â†’ Public memory trace.
This log preserves that cycle,
not as progress â€” but as accountability.

ğŸ“ FOI1 Summary

Section titled â€œğŸ“ FOI1 Summaryâ€

What was asked:
Whether Designated Inspectors (DIs) conducted inspections, produced outcome summaries, or faced internal review from 2022â€“2025.

What was revealed:

  • âˆ… Initial refusal under Section 26: no documents exist.
  • Only a blank template released.
  • âœ– Internal Review later admitted outcome reports exist â€” a direct contradiction.

Structural meaning:
FOI1 = Result vacuum. (The agency claimed no results existed, then contradicted itself.)

Status: â³ OIC external review ongoing (Ref: FOI2025-008).

ğŸ“¤ External Review â€“ OIC

Section titled â€œğŸ“¤ External Review â€“ OICâ€

ğŸ“ OIC Review Summary

Section titled â€œğŸ“ OIC Review Summaryâ€
  • Indefinite wait at acceptance (17 Jul); OIC Annual Report shows ~40% of reviews exceed 12 months (Report).
  • No written allocation policy admitted (16 Sep) â†’ discretionary, non-chronological triage = time black hole.
  • Counter-FOI lodged with OIC to obtain case-management protocols.

ğŸ§­ Oversight Escalation (Cycle 1)

Section titled â€œğŸ§­ Oversight Escalation (Cycle 1)â€

OAG = non-intervention
Together = oversight deadlock confirmed.

ğŸ”„ FOI Process Flow

Section titled â€œğŸ”„ FOI Process Flowâ€

FOI Request (Freedom of Information)
â†“
Agency Response

  • âœ“ Documents released
  • âˆ… â€œNo documentsâ€ (Section 26)
  • âœ– Refused / Exempt
  • ~ Extension / Procedural delay
    â†“
    Internal Review (IR)
  • Applicant challenges decision inside same agency
  • Agency may confirm, reverse, or contradict itself
    â†“
    External Review (ER) â€“ OIC
  • Independent review of whether the search was â€œreasonableâ€
  • BUT: often indefinite backlog, opaque allocation
    â†“
    Ombudsman / Auditor General / Parliament
  • Higher oversight bodies
  • Risk of deadlock: Ombudsman wonâ€™t act until OIC concludes
    â†“
    Public Archive (unseenbeings.org)
  • All refusals, delays, contradictions documented as record

ğŸ“– Glossary of Key Terms

Section titled â€œğŸ“– Glossary of Key Termsâ€
  • FOI (Freedom of Information) â€“ Legal right to request government documents.
  • Section 26 â€“ Official refusal: agency claims â€œno documents exist.â€
  • IR (Internal Review) â€“ Second look by the same agency when you challenge a decision.
  • ER (External Review) â€“ Escalation to the Information Commissioner (OIC). Checks only if a â€œreasonable searchâ€ was done.
  • OIC (Office of the Information Commissioner) â€“ Handles ER, but operates with backlog and no transparent triage rules.
  • Ombudsman â€“ Investigates maladministration, but usually only after OIC finishes â†’ procedural loop.
  • OAG (Office of the Auditor General) â€“ Audits government operations, but rarely intervenes in live FOI disputes.
  • DPIRD (Department of Primary Industries and Regional Development) â€“ WA government department responsible for animal welfare enforcement.
  • AWAC (Animal Welfare Advisory Committee) â€“ Statutory committee meant to advise on animal welfare policy and oversight; however, in practice provides no evidence of supervising DI enforcement.
  • Vacuum â€“ A structural gap: missing results, missing processes, or missing accountability.
  • Deadlock â€“ Oversight bodies blocking each other; no action moves forward.
